cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across Hispaniola and Cuba, then forecast to curve northwest into the Gulf of Mexico toward the central U.S. Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coastline (central–west LA) or adjacent upper Texas coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for the U.S. Virgin Islands
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for the U.S. Virgin Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Dominican Republic, Haiti, Cuba, Turks & Caicos, southeast and central Bahamas, Florida Keys, and the central-west U.S. Gulf Coast are in or near the cone
weather_observation.culmulative_wind_34kt: Data not provided for St. Croix
weather_observation.culmulative_wind_50kt: Data not provided for St. Croix
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of tropical-storm-force winds (≈40–50 mph gusts) have already affected the port area; no additional strong winds expected as Laura departs
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers with locally heavy bursts possible, but widespread amounts >4 inches are not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous surf in outer marine approaches for the next 12–18 h
